fields.headline: Dawood's dream day
fields.bodyText: Ismail Dawood will become the first British-born Asian to play first-class cricket for Yorkshire when they take on Somerset in the Frizzell County Championship in Scarborough today. Yorkshire are hoping that Dawood, who will be 28 on Friday, can solve their wicket-keeping problems, and the player is excited at the prospect of making his championship bow for the county. "There is definitely a chance to stake a claim for the wicketkeeping position and I'm hoping to grab it with both hands," he said. "This is a huge opportunity for me and I'm confident that I'm up to the task." Dawood, who has played in Yorkshire's one-day team this season, was born in Dewsbury but has been something of a cricketing nomad, playing for Northamptonshire, Worcestershire and Glamorgan before dropping out of the professional ranks in 1999. He is studying for a degree at Leeds Metropolitan University and last summer scored a century against Yorkshire while playing for Bradford-Leeds UCCE.
